taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

taxonConcepts.scientificName: Barbichthys laevis (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1842)
Barbichthys laevis (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1842)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Found mainly in medium to large-sized rivers (Ref. 12975).  Found in large rivers during the dry season and in floodplain streams and canals during the wet season.  Does not persist in impoundments (Ref. 12693).  Feeds on algae (Ref. 12975), phytoplankton (Ref. 12693), fish and crustaceans (Ref. 56749).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Malay Peninsula, Sumatra, Borneo and Java (Ref. 26580); Mekong and Chao Phraya basins (Ref. 43281).
dataObjects.references: Doi, A. 1997 A review of taxonomic studies of cypriniform fishes in Southeast Asia. Jap. J. Ichthyol. 44(1):1-33. (Ref. 26580)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Kottelat, M. 2001 Fishes of Laos. WHT Publications Ltd., Colombo 5, Sri Lanka. 198 p. (Ref. 43281)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Enlarged suborbital bones occupying most of cheek; each caudal lobe with a dark stripe; longitudinal stripe across dorsal (Ref. 43281).

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Huckstorf, V. & Freyhof, J. 2013. Barbichthys laevis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
Huckstorf, V. & Freyhof, J.

Reviewer/s
Rainboth, W., Ng, H.H., Kullander, S.O., Kottelat, M. & Allen, D.J.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species is assessed as Least Concern because, although there are potential threats (e.g. overfishing, river modifications) to the species within it's range, it has a large distribution area.
